titleStmt.title: William A. Gaines to Ephraim L. Van Winkle
CWG1203

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, 1863-1867

body.p:
Frankfort Ky Monday Oct 9.th 1865
E L Vanwinkle Esqr
Dear Sir

I go down this morning to make arrangements with one of the Surratts to have a well bored on the Grider property. I will remain in Louisville until tomorrow morning I remained at home since Friday to see you expecting you to be back Saturday. Lyne has gotten up the company at Henderson. Enclosed I hand you his letter
If you should want to telegraph me to-day about anything I will be at the Louisville Hotel. Will be back in a week or 10 days

Very truly Yours
W. A. Gaines.

P. S.
Have sold 133 shares Beaty. expet to sell a good ^d^eal more when I return
